Question Number 5:

the isEqual function compares two objects. If each of the objects has the same keys and those keys have the same values, then they are considered equal

console.log(isEqual({ a: 1 }, {a : 1}));//true
console.log(isEqual({ a: 1 }, {a : 3}));//false
console.log(isEqual({ a: 1, x: 2 }, {a : 1}));//false
console.log(isEqual({ a: 1 }, {a : 1, x: 2}));//false
console.log(isEqual({ a: 1, b: 2 }, {b: 2, a : 1}));//true

please export you function at the end: module.exports = yourFunction
